meaningMnemonic: When the <kanji>evening</kanji> is <kanji>burning</kanji> with sun, it is the sun going down, getting all close to the horizon and earth. This is the <vocabulary>sunset</vocabulary>, or more specifically, the <vocabulary>evening glow</vocabulary> you can see during a sunset.
readingMnemonic: The readings are the kun'yomi vocab readings. Combine 夕 and 焼け (you learned the reading via the kanji) and you'll have <reading>ゆうやけ</reading>.
